p: Low socio-economic status (SES) in many settings has been associated with increased risk for arboviral infection [ 17â€“ 19]. Poverty creates ideal conditions for vector proliferation, such as limited access to water infrastructure, garbage disposal services, street drainage, sewage systems, and yard maintenance [ 20, 21]. It is important to understand the associations between arbovirus transmission and environmental risk factors in order to apply appropriate control measures that may reduce transmission and eliminate arboviruses in endemic areas.
